text: If a mentee has not checked in for 14 days, send a gentle reminder emphasising that there's no pressure and you're here when they're ready.
Re-engage dormant pairs by suggesting a specific, low-commitment activity like sharing one win from the past fortnight.
Celebrate small wins by acknowledging specific achievements and linking them to broader career goals.
Balance one-sided conversations by asking open-ended questions that encourage the quieter party to share their perspective.
If conversations feel mentor-heavy, try the 70-30 rule where mentees speak 70% of the time during your sessions.
When goals are blocked, help break them into smaller milestones that can build momentum despite obstacles.
Reframe blocked goals as learning opportunities by exploring what insights have emerged from the challenge.
Recognise progress by comparing current state to three months ago, highlighting specific growth areas.
Revitalise dormant relationships with a simple 'thinking of you' message and one relevant resource or article.
Address conversation imbalance by explicitly inviting input: 'I'd love to hear your thoughts on this.'
Navigate blocked goals by exploring alternative paths that achieve similar learning outcomes.
Amplify achievements by encouraging mentees to share their wins with their broader team or network.
